I help Galvanize Graduates find meaningful work by providing coaching, curriculum, and connections to enhance and advance their careers. I also help companies connect to Galvanize talent by getting them involved in our community through recruitment of our grads, mentorship & tutoring of our students, and speaking opportunities to our membership base.Hiring our grads is free! If you're searching for people with the aptitude, drive, and determination to be an outstanding addition to your team, email me at maria.montoya@galvanize.com.

From talent branding, recruitment, onboarding, to ongoing experience, I served the Ipro community by attracting the right people and finding new, impactful ways of making their work experience delightful.

In 16 months I had added 80+ new faces to the business, filling hard-to-fill roles with no prior recruiting experience. Through hosting meetups, traditional sourcing, attending tech networking events, and leveraging referrals, I did full life-cycle hiring for Operations, Product Development, Marketing and Engineering. During this time, I also re-designed the company-wide hiring process, and created an empowering training series to calibrate leaders to hire the Infusionsoft way. From ideation to content creation to delivery, in collaboration with my team, we delivered the first ever hiring manager training for the company, now a regular part of manager development.
How to Hire the Right Person for Your Small Business
How to Hire the Right Person for Your Small Business

Being new to recruiting, I collaborate with executives from across Infusionsoft to find Marketing, People, Finance, and Partner Channel talent for the company. Learning on the fly and without formal training, I aided in the hiring of key/ mission critical roles.Unlike most hiring teams, the Infusionsoft hiring team was unique in that we were seen as strategic hiring partners. As such, we were involved in annual headcount planning, consulted with leaders on organizational development plans, and served as internal SMEs for hiring-related activities. Through a collaborative process, we coached leaders through identifying what "right fit" looks like, and consulted with hiring managers to create the right roles and find the right people for the business' needs.

After being promoted into this role, as a hands-on leader, I trained and managed career services staff to deliver consistent, quality service to students.  In my second reporting year at Bryan, now as the supervisor of 2 additional staff, we beat our previous record by nearly 15%.
Speech & Debate (2 years), Latin Student Union (4 years), Study abroad in Seville, Spain (1 semester).

Katie is a trustworthy, dependable, and execution-oriented collaborator. I partnered with  Katie on planning for and setting up several public events while at Galvanize (Specifically, our Partner Open House, and our Student Capstone Day). She was incredibly responsive, which allowed me to focus on the content of the events, rather than focusing on the logistics and set up (which she took total ownership of). Both events were wildly successful, and went off without a hitch. I high recommend Katie if you're looking for an events and/or coordination powerhouse.

Mary is a rare, unicorn-like mix of compassion, execution, detail, and vision. Her ability to flex to the needs of the business, and her team, especially in a fast paced environment, is remarkable. Mary took on the challenge of leading benefits initiatives with no prior experience, within her first 2 months of joining Infusionsoft. It wasn't what she was hired to do - but it needed to get done, and so she did it with finesse, and without hesitation. Since she's been at Infusionsoft she's touched every faced of HR/ People, making her a well rounded HR professional. She's no doubt a rising star, and I can't wait to see what she does next!

summary: We never get time back. My purpose in life is to help people find joy in their waking life. That's why I am in the career of Careers. My career history in Professional Coaching, Career Service Delivery, and Technical Recruitment for SaaS companies is woven together by a powerful theme: I aim to aid others in using their waking hours wisely, finding meaning in what they do. Whether I'm designing employment experiences, coaching others to manager their own careers, or creating meaningful social events through Sunday Assembly, my unified goal is simple: live deliberately, and help others do the same, within and outside work. I am currently the Career Services and Partner Relations Manager of Galvanize's Phoenix campus. In this role, I aim to serve each Galvanize grad by helping them find meaningful work after their academic journey. I also serve businesses by helping them amplify their Talent Brand by getting involved in the Galvanize community.
name: Maria Montoya
title: Career Services & Partner Relations Manager | Career Existentialist | Professional Development Nerd
